top_comment.text:
The fascination of big butts really started with Saartjie "Sarah" Baartman 
in the 1800s. She was taken from her home in South Africa and sold into 
slavery in her 20's, however, she was extremely voluptuous- large breast, 
butt, thighs, lips- the image that people try to attain now. People had 
never seen anything like her (aka: a black woman's naked body). She was put 
on display in a circus, for her "exotic" look in London, Ireland and then 
to France. She was stripped naked, dancing for people's entertainment so 
they can see, touch and laugh at the "oddly" proportioned woman who they 
also nicknamed "Hottentot Venus". Even after she died at just 25 years old, 
France kept her skeleton, preserved genitals & brain and a plaster of her 
actual body on display until 1974!!! That is almost 160 years!!! Sarah 
became an object to fulfill people curiosity and crazy fetishes (i.e. rape 
and whatever else they did to her). Now people go through surgery to get 
what she was born with. It is sad how much people are fascinated with it. 
It's even more sad to think that this "big booty movement" started with 
Beyonce, J-Lo, Kimmy K., or Nicki! I bet if many people knew some history, 
they wouldn't be as obsessive over it but more sympathetic towards Sarah 
and see how sickening it actually is... ﻿
